Let's remove Ults that consist of some Extreme mechanic, taking out Camille, Warwick, Nocturne. We're left with Hec, Irelia, Lee, Aatrox, and Jax. Jax's, Irelia's, and Aatrox are self-buffs, with a large portion of Jax's power in his Ult Passive regardless, so let's cut them out. So we're left with Lee and Hecarim. 

Now let's look at the difference once again between the two. Lee's Ult does not *Normally* give him access to the backline, while Hecarim's gives him innate access due to intargetibility. If a Lee is smart, and good, perhaps he may get to a tank, knock 'em back to the backline, and Q 'em mid process to get back there easily, but that is very situational. 

Let's be honest with ourselves, Lee ult isn't going to hit all 4 people, and he'd be very hard-pressed to hit one against a properly organized team. Lee falls off due to the fact that Team's don't allow Lee easy access to the back-line, outside of outplay. Other Divers don't have that problem due to their own kits, and unless the Lee is ahead, he isn't going to be able to do much against a good front line.

With all that said, Lee has a shorter CD on his Ult, because unlike other Divers, Lee lacks a way late game to break that front-line. Diver's primary targets are Squishies, though they ain't bad against Tanks, and against a Smart organized comp, Lee has no way to get to his targets, unless Via Outplay. 

That's why he has Ward-hops, that's why he has a Low CD Ult, they are tools for him to use to be successful by *how* he uses them, and not tools to be successful by *just* using them. Lee's difficulty is not in learning and getting used to him, but in learning how to use all his tools to be successful against a good team. 

Now, the argument could be made for it to be longer early game, and I might be behind that with good reasoning, but late game, it's his only way to contribute against a competent team.

Even the shittiest lees can play the champ somewhat effectively, which is why he seems so strong at the moment.  However he has an almost infinite skill ceiling with different plays he can make, that many players cannot do.  

Vi is more reliable and with the right build, even better at getting into the backline and oneshotting carries.  I would argue that Vi is more useful lategame as her R is 120% more reliable.  Lee tends to fall off, and become an r bot, unless people get caught out.    

PS: I'm not the best lee, but I can do r flash, and insec.  These skills took a lot of time to develop and I still can't do them 100% consistency, and I've played ~500 games of Lee.

That's the issue with Lee right now.

Vi does tend to be more reliable, I give you that, but right now, she is reliably sub-par for anyone not familiar with her. I have a 56% winrate on her over about 700 ranked games over seasons 5-7, and probably have over 1000 total if you include normals as well, but the average Vi player right now had below 50% with a 6.5% play rate. Compare that to lee with a win rate of 48% with a 30% win rate. Granted, that includes all the bronze players that think they can play him, so if we take only high elo for the both of them, Vi has the same win and play rate, but Lee has a slightly above 50% win rate with a *40% play rate*. Which as almost everyone agrees, is so stupidly high it isn't even funny. Imagine if Vayne or Riven had those kinds of numbers?

And while Lee does fall off, he has a 58% win rate in the early (before 25 min) and it take until 35 minutes for him to hit a 50% win rate. That is super late game, with today's game times. Vi takes the same amount of time to *reach* a 50% win rate. So yeah, in the rare game that it goes late, Vi is better, but even then its not by much.

How do you get the 120% better number for Vi's ult by the way? Her ult does the same base damage as Lee, but only has a 140% ratio, and does 75% of the damage to everyone else she hits. Lee has a 200% ratio, that does not only the full damage to everyone that is hit, but also 18% of the kicked target's bonus HP.

That's only if his ult hits something else.  Not every Lee ult hits a secondary target, and neither does Vi ult.  Vi ult in low elo (the elo you and I are in) is exceptionally strong, and in fact I would say stronger than Lee sin ult.  You are right on the safety aspect, but the dmg output is nowhere near the levels of Vayne or Riv.  To be completely fair about it, neither of us should have commentary on either champion.  In high elo lee sin makes it through ban phase which means that they don't have too many problems dealing with him.
